subtitle: The ready-made toffees melted down slowly make this recipe wonderfully gooey.

method.text: In a medium sized bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy. Beat in the egg and then fold in the flour, cocoa and vanilla essence.
Spoon the mixtures into individual greased dariole or castle-shaped moulds. Cover each one with foil, pleated in the centre to allow for the sponge to rise.
Place the moulds onto a trivet in a large pan. Pour in enough boiling water to come up to the top of the trivet. Cover and steam for 30 min, topping up with water when necessary.
Meanwhile, to make the sauce, place the chocolate eclair toffees and cream in a small basin over a saucepan of boiled water. Stir until melted.
Carefully remove the moulds from the pan. Gently loosen the edges of the sponge with a round bladed knife. Turn out the castles onto individual serving plates.
Serve immediately with the chocolate toffee sauce poured over, and topped with a small sprig of mint to decorate.

title: Chocolate toffee castles
